title: Repo sync
author: docs-bot
details: **TypeScript Conversion**: Converted multiple JavaScript files to TypeScript including `validator.js`, `all-versions.js`, `languages.js`, and data directory utilities.
**New Linter Rule**: Added table column integrity rule (GHD047) to ensure consistent column counts in Markdown tables.
**Lint Report Update**: Modified the lint report script to only include errors and expired content warnings, and renamed it from `post-lints` to `lint-report`.
**Configuration Changes**: Hard-coded language keys in `next.config.js` to avoid TypeScript import issues and updated GitHub Actions workflow to use the new lint report command.
summary:

- **Lint Report Update**: Modified the lint report script to only include errors and expired content warnings, and renamed it from `post-lints` to `lint-report`.
- **Configuration Changes**: Hard-coded language keys in `next.config.js` to avoid TypeScript import issues and updated GitHub Actions workflow to use the new lint report command.

original_description:
This is an automated pull request to sync changes between the public and private repos.
Our bot will merge this pull request automatically.
To preserve continuity across repos, _do not squash_ this pull request.
raw_analysis:
### Summary
- **TypeScript Conversion**: Converted multiple JavaScript files to TypeScript including `validator.js`, `all-versions.js`, `languages.js`, and data directory utilities.
- **New Linter Rule**: Added table column integrity rule (GHD047) to ensure consistent column counts in Markdown tables.
- **Lint Report Update**: Modified the lint report script to only include errors and expired content warnings, and renamed it from `post-lints` to `lint-report`.
- **Configuration Changes**: Hard-coded language keys in `next.config.js` to avoid TypeScript import issues and updated GitHub Actions workflow to use the new lint report command.

### Title
Convert files to TypeScript, add table column linter rule, and update lint report
